definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To rest in a horizontal position on a surface .
examples: The book lies on the table;  the snow lies on the roof;  he lies in his coffin.
Under an oak were lying asleep a pair of shepherds.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To be placed or situated .
( intransitive , copulative ) To abide ; to remain for a longer or shorter time ; to be in a certain state or condition .
examples: to lie waste; to lie fallow; to lie open; to lie hidden; to lie grieving; to lie under one's displeasure; to lie at the mercy of the waves
The paper does not lie smooth on the wall.

definitions.definition: Used with in : to be or exist ; to belong or pertain ; to have an abiding place; to consist .
Used with with : to have sexual relations with.
Used with on / upon : to be incumbent (on); to be the responsibility of a person.
To be still or quiet , like one lying down to rest.
( law ) To be sustainable ; to be capable of being maintained .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To rest in a horizontal position on a surface .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To be placed or situated .
( intransitive , copulative ) To abide ; to remain for a longer or shorter time ; to be in a certain state or condition .
Used with in : to be or exist ; to belong or pertain ; to have an abiding place; to consist .
Used with with : to have sexual relations with.
Used with on / upon : to be incumbent (on); to be the responsibility of a person.
To be still or quiet , like one lying down to rest.
( law ) To be sustainable ; to be capable of being maintained .

definitions.definition: To give false information intentionally with intent to deceive .
examples: When Pinocchio lies , his nose grows.
If you are found to have lied in court, you could face a penalty.

definitions.definition: To convey a false image or impression .
To be mistaken or unintentionally spread false information.
examples: Sorry, I haven't seen your keys anywhere...wait, I lied ! They're right there on the coffee table.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To give false information intentionally with intent to deceive .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To convey a false image or impression .
( intransitive , colloquial ) To be mistaken or unintentionally spread false information.
